alert.note: Alert for Mono (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 21 at 3:37AM PDT by NWS Reno
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of east central California, including the following area, Mono County. Portions of Nevada, including the following areas, Mineral and Southern Lyon Counties and Western Nevada Basin and Range including Pyramid Lake. * WHEN...Through late tonight. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of small creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Low-water crossings may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
